comments:
The primary objective of Marketing 755 is to provide the students with an opportunity to learn and apply the core theories, strategies, principles, and practices of effective advertising management. The course utilizes theory, marketing and communications research, and significant management experience that are relevant to design, evaluation, and management of advertising. The specific topics covered in the course include consumer segmentation and target selection, consumer motivation and insight, developing a powerful communications strategy and advertising idea, evaluating and optimizing advertising execution, and developing a targeted and effective consumer connections and media plan.

Student feedback on the course was generally positive. One student mentioned that the course contained a “good mix of learning frameworks.” A handful of students indicated that the guest speakers were enjoyable and worthwhile. However, many students expressed distaste with the teaching framework. Students expressed a desire for more clarity in assignment requirements and a wider variety of examples and cases.

Student evaluation of Professor Malcolm was mixed. Several students agreed that Professor Malcolm’s “real world experience was incredibly valuable in bringing the course lessons to life,” as one student put it. Some students thought that the professor was, at times, inflexible with students’ ideas and opinions and sometimes dismissed those that conflicted with his own.

According to many students, the grading system was not ideal and suggested that it be changed. One student noted, “The course is demanding and quite competitive.”
